text:
The relative directory where the work will be generating intermediate files 
    and output. The intermediate files will be placed in a subdirectory. 
    For the Local scheduler or Hqueue, typically

is used. For other 
    schedulers, this should be a relative directory to
; this path is then appended to these root paths.
The minimum time in seconds between calls to the onTick callback.
The maximum number of ready item onSchedule callbacks between ticks.

The absolute path to the (mounted) directory on the local machine which the 
    working directory is rooted at.

The path to the mounted directory on client machines which the working 
    directory will be rooted at. This can include variables that the farm is set
    to resolve to platform-specific paths.
Enable to override the callback server’s default port range.

The callback server’s port range values to use when overriding the
    default values.

As part of the cook, a message queue (MQ) job will be submitted, which is used to communicate information from executing jobs back to the submitting machine.  For this reason the farm machines must be able to resolve the hostnames of other farm machines.
This may be as simple as editing the
In addition, farm machines must either not have firewalls between them, or you must use the
to specify the open port to use.

When the cook starts, the submitting machine will connect to the farm machine that is running the MQ job, so farm machines must either not have firewalls between themselves and the submitting machine, or you must use the
